snippet: The judge said the S.E.C. did not meet its legal burden of showing why the the Securities Investor Protection Corporation should be compelled to act.
abstract: Federal district court judge rejects a Securities and Exchange Commission request for an industry-backed fund to start a court proceeding that could lead to compensation for victims of R Allen Stanford's $7 billion Ponzi scheme; says SEC did not meet its legal burden of showing why the Securities Investor Protection Corporation should be compelled to act.
lead_paragraph: The judge said the S.E.C. did not meet its legal burden of showing why the the Securities Investor Protection Corporation should be compelled to act.

headline.seo: S.E.C. Loses Ruling in Stanford Ponzi Scheme Case
headline.main: Judge’s Ruling Is Blow to Victims of Stanford Scheme
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Declines Request To Aid Stanford’s Ponzi Victims
